objects.name: Analytic 1474
objects.description: Unauthorized modification of TCC.db followed by elevated process execution under a trusted parent (e.g., Finder, SystemUIServer) or via launchctl environment override. Also includes identification of SIP being disabled, which is highly uncommon and a prerequisite for this abuse path.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Execution of binaries with TCC protected access under unexpected parent processes such as Finder.app, SystemUIServer, or nsurlsessiond

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Modification or replacement of /Library/Application Support/com.apple.TCC/TCC.db or ~/Library/Application Support/com.apple.TCC/TCC.db

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Execution of launchctl with setenv or bootout targeting TCC.db or AppleScript under Finder context

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: System Integrity Protection (SIP) state reported as disabled

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: May vary across macOS versions and user contexts; defenders can tune for known benign cases.
Custom user paths or redirected SQLite DBs may require alternate matching logic.
Temporal proximity between launchctl setenv and subsequent privileged access can be tuned.
Frequency of SIP integrity checks may vary based on system hardening policies.
